p: Hakea salicifolia (common name willow-leaved Hakea, Proteaceae) is a perennial shrub or small tree (up to 5 m) with reddish twigs. It was introduced in Portugal for ornamental purposes and for the formation of hedges in windy zones, near the shore. It is well adjusted to nutrient depleted soils, preferring sunny areas. It is native to Southeast Australia and Tasmania [ 9]. It is also invasive in Europe, Australia, New Zealand and South Africa [ 18]
